title: Used Book Stores that stock Science Fiction
name: Used Book Stores that stock Science Fiction

properties.name: 7th Ave S & Weller Seattle, WA
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox

properties.name: ABC Book & Comic Emporium
properties.description: Posted by CaptxeroxThese guys have been around for years, but change locations every few years. They\'re famous for having an entire wall of science fiction and fantasy. The selection is absolutely amazing, and the stock is sort by author\'s last name, so it\'s relatively easy to find what you\'re looking for. I\'m always finding rare gems in there. There\'s also a basement full of comics. Address: 1539 West Broadway, Vancouver, BC V6J 1W6.

properties.name: Abegweit Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox

properties.name: Acre  of Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox240 Long Beach Blvd,Long Beach, CA 90802 Biggest used book store I have ever been in, has every type of book categorized on rows and rows of shelves 12 feet high. Big Selection of Si-Fi Books in back Every now and then you will find a gem

properties.name: Alison The Bookman
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox342 Main St E., North Bay, ONOne of North America\'s largest and best-organized selections of used books with more than 200,000 titles in stock. There are lots and lots of science fiction books to wade through. Good stuff! 705-476-1450

properties.name: Another Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1535 Stanley St, New Britain, CTOff campus textbook store, but there is a Sci-Fi class that is taught every year, so they carry a bunch of Sci-Fi novels.

properties.name: Argo Bookshop
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 1915, rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest, Montréal, QC H3H 1M314-931-3442 Rating: 8/10 Good selection at reasonable prices a lot of variety, lots of star trek though, but good fairly recent titles in other SF&F categories.

properties.name: Bakka Phoenix
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox697 Queen Street West, Toronto, ON, Canada

properties.name: Big Chicken Barn
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1768 Bucksport Rd., Ellsworth, METhis old chicken barn has been converted into an antiques and bookstore. Antiques are on the ground floor, books are upstairs and by are there a lot of books. It\'s fairly well organized by genre, but you\'ll have to spend a lot of time combing through the collection just in case you don\'t miss something! 207-667-7308

properties.name: Big Chicken Barn
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1768 Bucksport Rd., Ellsworth, ME

properties.name: Book Market
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox3383-A Blvd.des Sources, Dollard des Ormeaux, QC514-683-9890 Rating: 7/10 The Book Market will buy anything. They can afford to since they only pay a few cents per book and charge exorbitant prices. The upside is that you can sometimes find offbeat books that other places might overlook. They usually have a good selection of newer SF titles, but like any used book store, it can vary wildly.

properties.name: Book Market
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2765 St.Charles Blvd, Kirkland, QC514-694-1546 Rating: 7 / 10 The Book Market will buy anything. They can afford to since they only pay a few cents per book and charge exorbitant prices. The upside is that you can sometimes find offbeat books that other places might overlook. They usually have a good selection of newer SF titles, but like any used book store, it can vary wildly.

properties.name: Booklovers
properties.description: Posted by CaptxeroxAbsolutely huge inventory, piled in the aisles, and almost completely disorganised. You can find all kinds of stuff in the unsorted piles, but if you can fight your way through the the East wall, you\'ll find those science fiction and fantasy books which have been sorted out from the rest of the jumble. Address: #102-175 East Third Street, North Vancouver, BC, V7L 1E5.

properties.name: Bookman's Entertainent Exchange
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1930 E Grant Rd Tucson, AZ 85719

properties.name: Bookseller SW Welch
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox3878 St Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Y2514-848-9358 Rating: 7 / 10 514-848-9358 Rating: 7 / 10 Welch has a very good selection of SF. A lot of it is older stuff, including such collectibles as Ace Doubles. The prices are a bit above average, but it is a good place to look for unusual items.

properties.name: Boutique Relire
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox3675 boul. Taschereau, Saint-Hubert, Québec, J4T 2G3450-445-8059

properties.name: Buckeye Bookshop
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox795 Brittain Road, Akron OH 44305a large books store with 4 book cases (and a little more) of Science Fiction. http://www.abebooks.com/home/BUCKEYE buckeye@raex.com

properties.name: Café Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1420, rue Stanley, Montréal, QC H3A 1P7514-287-9929 Rating: 8 / 10 Their SF section is first rate. There are plenty of classics and obscure titles. Not much new stuff, but if you want new stuff you can go to Chapters. Prices are good.

properties.name: Cheap Thrills
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2044 Metcalfe, Montréal, QC H3A 1X8514-844-8988 Rating: 7/ 10 This Montreal institution has shuttered its Bishop St. store and now can only be found on Metcalfe St., near McgGill University. The prices remain good, but the science fiction shelves have been reduced in favour of more mystery novels.

properties.name: Colisée du Livre
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 908 St. Catherine St. East, Montreal, QuebecThe English books are upstairs along the wall. There are hundreds of books, but they are totally unorganized. Fortunately, they are all arranged in tables with the spines up so it\'s relatively easy to scan the titles. You\'ll find some science fiction gems hidden in the dross if you look long enough. (514) 845-1792

properties.name: Dave's Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox270 Main Street, Old Town, ME(207) 827-4510

properties.name: Dusty Bookshelf
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox700 N Manhattan Ave, Manhattan KS

properties.name: Goodwill
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox230 Elm St, Somerville, MA 02144This is one of the finest Goodwill stores anywhere. The staff are helpful. Some surley, some friendly, but all helpful. They play great music. They have hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of books of all genres. E-Bayers line up outside the door just before opening time to get in there and pick through the bins, but you still find some gems. Lots of science fiction and often really cool old craft books from the bygone days of crochet and puppets.

properties.name: Half Price Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2025 S. Hurstbourne Parkway, LOUISVILLE, KY, 40220-1623Just south of I64 in JTown, KY, on Hurstborne. Entrance is a bit tricky off of HB, exit is worse. However, nice store, nice people. Also buys books. Not specialized, any old book might be here.

properties.name: Hole in the Wall Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 905 W Broad Street (Rt 7), Falls Church, VA 22046

properties.name: L'Echange
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 713, avenue du Mont-Royal Est, Montréal, QC H2J 1W7 514-523-6389 Rating: 5 / 10 There are little if any English books on SF, but plenty to chose from in the French section. But be cautioned that this place was very cramped, and filled with people, so you\'re always bumping someone. l\'Échange Mt-Royal and l\'Échange St-Denis are totally separate entities. From my experience, Mt-Royal has a bigger Scifi collection, albeit mixed in with the Fantasy stuff, (and it overflows on surrounding shelves these days), the little English mixed with the French... Yeah, little English, and bound to a few either timelessly mainstream authors, or more actual, commercially viable titles (which ain\'t always a bad thing...)

properties.name: L'Echange St-Denis
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 3694, rue Saint-Denis, Montréal, QC H2X 3L7 514-849-1913 Rating: 5 / 10 COSMIC - l\'Échange on St-Denis was very small but not as cramped as the one on Mt-Royal. The prices were cheaper, and they had a full bookcase reserved for English books. The picking for SF&F was slim, but I still managed to walk away with 3 titles. NICOLAS Q. - In my experience, l\'Échange on St-Denis is a no go for English Sci-fi, while their French section is pretty small. For comics, or "bandes dessinées", St-Denis has the upper hand, as well as a larger selection. ROSEMARIE - Good selection of CDs mostly, two shelves of comics, and a lot of French books, SF in English is sparse with a few titles here and there. Recommended for French books, and CDs.

properties.name: La Booktique
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox81 Donegani, Pointe Claire, QC 514-694-5553 Rating: 8 / 10 This shop is a must for West Islanders. It features a healthy selection of science fiction, fantasy and horror. The books are obviously bought with a discerning eye as most of the books are of recent vintage and high quality. The prices are reasonable and there is plenty of choice. What more could you ask? They even have a frequent-buyer program: buy 0 of books and get of books free.

properties.name: Librairie de la Montée
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox5317 Montéé Saint-Hubert, Saint-Hubert, Québec, J3Y 1V8450-926-8822 Good selection of Science Fiction in english and french, also placed by subjects. Decent prices, usually 1/3 to 1/2 price of book. Closed Mondays.

properties.name: Librarie Astro
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1844 St.Catherine W., Montreal, QC(514) 932-1139 Rating: 7/10 This store has a decent stock of SF title, mostly recent stuff. Look for cheaper and older stuff in the back. They also sell comics and have the attraction of not charging taxes on their books, including new titles.

properties.name: Librarie Mona Lisait
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2054 St-Denis, Montreal, QC514-849 0987 Rating: 5 / 10 COSMIC - The collection of SF&F is at a minimal in the English section, there is simply an English reserved bookcase seperated by authors, there you will find mostly the classics (Stevenson, Wells, Swift, Poe, etc.) at very good prices. But there is a decent collection of French books on the subject, although I have always hated the fact that French books go for more than twice the price of an english book of the same size. One of the owners of the store wrote in to add these comments: "Ceci est un message de la Librairie Mona Lisait. J\'ai lu ce que vous dites de nos livres de SF anglais. Je pense que vous n\'avez pas vu le rayon de SF anglais qui est séparé du rayon Fiction anglais Il se trouve près du rayon SF français et n\'est pas très visible! Au plaisir de vous revoir!!"

properties.name: Librarie Québecoise
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox924 Ste Catherine E., Montreal, QuebecA nicely-organized store. Most of its wares are in French, but there is a decent selection of English science fiction books in the back. There are also many bandes dessinées. Prices are excellent. 514-848-9888

properties.name: Logos Books & Records
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1117 Pacific Ave, Santa Cruz, CAhttp://local.yahoo.com/details?id=21583086

properties.name: Mars
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox372 St.Catherine St. W., Montreal, QC514-844-4329 Rating: 1 / 10 With a name like Mars, you\'d think this was a good spot to load up on science fiction books. Actually, the store is a joke. The owner is a pack rat who stocks his firetrap of a store with mounds of books, magazines, records, posters and all sorts of crap. To be visited at your own risk.

properties.name: My favorite Book store- Powells
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox469 Milton, Montreal, QC

properties.name: Norma Comics
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox

properties.name: Odyssey Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1439 rue Stanley, Montreal, QC, H3A 1P4This store\'s SF selection is not very lage, but usually features quality titles. It\'s near the Peel Metro Station and not far from the big Chapters on St. Catherine and Cafe Books is across the street so it doesn\'t hurt to visit if you\'re in the area.

properties.name: Pandemonium Books & Games
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox4 Pleasant Street, Cambridge Massachusetts 02139Pandemonium Books & Games opened in 1989. Our first location was over the Wursthaus in Harvard Square, a space which had previously belonged to the Science Fantasy Bookstore. We relocated to The Garage Mall in Harvard Square in1993, and have recently moved to a palatial storefront in Central Square, Cambridge.

properties.name: Paradis du Livre
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox5153 Wellington, Verdun, QC514-767-2589 Rating: 9 / 10 I wasn\'t sure how this place would turn out, it has a French name, it\'s bit cramped, but filled to the rim with books. I have to admit I was quite surprised at the amount of English SF books they have which is about 4 (x) seven feet tall Bookcases (x) 9 shelves each (x) appr 30 books each (=) about 1080 SF books with an impressive variety of authors. And this not counting the cheap book boxes on the floor. I was also surprised at the prices, compared with downtown, this place beats them by about a 50c to a dollar per book, well worth the time to go to. The books are separated by category and authors and they even have special sections for Star Trek, Books made into movies, Television shows, etc.

properties.name: Planet M
properties.description: Posted by Nixonrodmumbaiplace for books DVD for music etc

properties.name: Powell's Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1005 W Burnside St, Portland, OROne of the hugest bookstores anywhere. Their Sci-Fi section is stocked with new and used, so bring a big backpack.

properties.name: Regent Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1855 St. Catherine St. W., Montreal, QC(514) 937-7617 Rating: 7/10 This used to be Vortex book shop which had more of a literary bent. This incarnation of the store is much more mainstream, including a decent group of shelves with science fiction and fantasy content.

properties.name: Russell Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox734 Fort Street Victoria, B.C.Russell Books first started in Montreal in 1962. It began as a small 300 square foot, one aisle, used bookstore and gradually grew into the biggest used, antiquarian and remainder bookstore in Montreal. In 1991 Reg Russell, founder of Russell Books, helped open a Victoria branch with his daughter Diana and her husband Ron DePol at 734 Fort Street, where it is today.

properties.name: Salvation Army Family Thrift Store
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox 5005 Boulevard des Sources, Pierrefonds, QC514-683-6414 Rating: 6 / 10 The Salvation Army is the place to go for cheap books. Unfortunately, they are totally unsorted and the science fiction selection is minimal. Still, it\'s a great place to browse for musty, old paperbacks. The downtown location has an immense number of books for sale at the ridiculous price of 50 cents. The Salvation Army operates a number of other thrift stores across the island.

properties.name: Salvation Army Thrift Store
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1620 Notre Dame St. W., Montreal, QC514-935-7425 Rating: 6 / 10 The Salvation Army is the place to go for cheap books. Unfortunately, they are totally unsorted and the science fiction selection is minimal. Still, it\'s a great place to browse for musty, old paperbacks. The downtown location has an immense number of books for sale at the ridiculous price of 50 cents. The Salvation Army operates a number of other thrift stores across the island.

properties.name: Sunrise books
properties.description: Posted by CaptxeroxSunrise Books Used books crammed to the ceiling and stacked on the floor. Way cool!

properties.name: The Bookseller
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox39 Westgate Circle, Akron, Ohio 44313A great store for old books and books on Americana and Akron history. They have a very interesting, if small, science fiction section (only 4 book cases). Been in business for over 30 years.

properties.name: The Word
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox469 Milton, Montreal, QC514-845-5640 Although their selection may not be the most complete nor diverse, it does include some of the bigger names, such as Asimov. Prices are average, but if you look high and low, you can find some cheapies, such as the 50 cent giveaways in the front.

properties.name: The other change of hobbit bookstore
properties.description: Posted by PhilocerA bookstore next to the university campus. What do you expect!

properties.description: Posted by CaptxeroxLos Angeles, CA

properties.name: Trident
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox338 Newbury Street, Boston, MA(617) 267-8688. Open until midnight seven days a week.

properties.name: Uncle Hugo's Science Fiction Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2864 Chicago Avenue South, Minneapolis MN 55407http://www.unclehugo.com/prod/ http://www.startribune.com/389/story/996898.html

properties.name: Uncle Hugo's Science Fiction Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2864 Chicago Avenue South, Minneapolis MN 55407

properties.name: Westcott Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox2065 St.Catherine W., Montreal, QC514-846-4037 Rating: 7 / 10 Westcott\'s science fiction selection is small, but it\'s good. I\'ve found plenty of older anthologies here, but I\'ve noticed that the SF section seems to be getting smaller. I don\'t know if he\'s buying many new books these days.

properties.name: Westernesse Books
properties.description: Posted by CaptxeroxDespite the implication of the name, which might lead you to believe that this is a fantasy specialty shop, it\'s a general interest bookstore, but it does have a couple of racks of science fiction and fantasy. Address: 152 West Fifteenth Street, North Vancouver, BC, V7M 1R5

properties.name: Zeeba Books
properties.description: Posted by Captxerox1414 avenue Victoria, Greenfield Park, Québec, J4V 1M1450-672-2662

properties.description: Posted by Captxerox161 court st 11201great books
